column4: I'm trying to get permission to my rc.local file to edit it, sksudo gedit doesn't seem to be working
gksudo
an admin windows apears and then disapears the program doesn't start
tried with « sudo nano /etc/rc.local » ?
not yet... I'll try...
/etc/sudoers is owned by uid 33, should be 0
you have a busted sudoers file ?
I may have messed it up trying to get permission to it myself
what have you doe ? changed the permission of that file ? or you did it for more files ?
I done it to the etc directory I want access to all my files
so your install is borked beyond repair... :|
you will have to reinstall i'm afraid
not all of ubunto I hope
yes all of ubuntu... that's easier than repairing all the permissions of the hundreds files in /etc/
I did it with 1 command?
yep; mass changing file permissions is almost allways the worng answer in linux (specially of things under /etc/ )
I don't have this computer backed up I have things I need.
no repair mode as far as i know... clean install
Can't I just change the permissions to anyone?
will cp still work I can backup everything on a different drive.
